subSubSection.paragraph:
Gasteropacha [sic] eversmanni Kindermann
in Eversmann, 1843 , Bull. Soc. Imper. Nat. Moscou 16 ( 3 ): 542 , pl. 10 , figs. 2 abc. TL: Sarepta. Types : males, female ( ZISP ).
References : Barou 1967 : 54 ; Daricheva & Dubatolov 1990 : 29 ; Modarres Awal 1994 & 1997 : 208 .
Distribution (Map 21 ): southern Russia and Caucasus through Siberia, Kazakhstan , Kyrgyzstan , Uzbekistan ,
Tadjikistan , Turkmenistan , western China to Israel , Turkey , Syria , Iraq , and Afghanistan . - In Iran : West Azer-
baijan, East Azerbaijan , Ardebil, Mazandaran, Golestan, Khorasan, Semnan, Tehran, Qazvin, Hamedan, Ker-
manshah, Markazi, Qom, Esfahan, Lorestan, Kohkiluyeh va Boyerahmad, Chaharmahal va Bakhtiari, Fars ,
Hormozgan, Kerman and Sistan va Baluchestan provinces.

Bionomics . The species is univoltine throughout its range. Flight period August to October, in Iran from late August to November. Inhabits lowlands to mid altitudes in Iran from 830 to 3150 m ; more typical of arid biotopes and lowlands. Larvae are polyphagous and recorded from
Ammodendron conollyi Bunge
( Papilionaceae ),
Caragana fruticosa
,
Astragalus
spp .,
Medicago
sp. ( Fabaceae ),
Calligonum setosum Litv.
,
C. turcestanicum Kozlov-Pavl.
,
C. griseum
( Polygonaceae ),
Haloxylon persicum Bunge ex Boiss
( Chenopodiaceae ),
Carex physodes
M. B. (Carecaceae),
Bromus tectorum
L. ( Poaceae ),
Ephedra strobilacea
( Ephedraceae ),
Artemisia
sp. ( Asteraceae ),
Rosa persica
( Rosaceae ),
Ferula
sp. ( Apiaceae ),
Ammodendron conollyi
( Papilionaceae ),
Zygophyllum gontscharovi
. Pupation in parchment-like cocoon on the soil or on bark. Eggs hibernate.
